body:
### Problem

Starting with neovim 0.10 and the highlight breaking changes I'm seeing a strange behavior when closing fzf.vim floating windows. This only happens when using fzf.vim and with certain conditions but I don't know if it's a bug with neovim or fzf.vim itself. Everytime I close an fzf floating window the window borders will flash the _Normal_ highlight color.

![ss_2024_05_31_15_31_02](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/14960414/adc9ae9e-8045-4b02-b157-d146ec187a2c)
![ss_2024_05_31_15_31_04](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/14960414/fbc3677f-b206-4392-92b9-b49f95bb120c)

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/14960414/cf609b3d-d554-49df-a2c5-69d469b92a6c

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/14960414/a7770176-7f5c-4c42-befd-72f53310ec72

This does not happen with neovim 0.9.5. Please let me know if the videos attached do not work for you so I can upload them elsewhere.

### Steps to reproduce

I think there's too many variables at play to be able to provide a reproduction, sorry. I really have no idea to whom I should direct this to.

### Expected behavior

The floating window should not flash a different border color on close.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

v0.11.0-dev-147+gd62d181ce0

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

I don't have vim installed

### Operating system/version

Arch Linux

### Terminal name/version

foot version: 1.17.2 +pgo +ime +graphemes -assertions

### $TERM environment variable

foot

### Installation

AUR

title: Closing floating window flashes Normal highlight color when using fzf.vim (Neovim bug or fzf.vim?) Started happening with neovim 0.10
